2.speaker: PENGUIN
2.english: That would be Tandoori. That would be the Awa Dance {\i1}(Awa Odori){\i0}.

4.speaker: PENGUIN
4.english: So why is the Panda Corner in a slump?

5.speaker: PANDA
5.japanese: ペンギン戦隊ショーに お客さんとられちゃって…
5.english: The Penguin Action Hero Show took our visitors.

9.speaker: PENGUINS
9.japanese: 南極戦隊 ペンギンジャー！

10.speaker: SASAKO
10.japanese: へぇ～ 大人気なんですね
10.english: Wow, it must be doing very well.

11.speaker: PENGUIN
11.japanese: でも 何か物足りない気がしない？
11.english: But don't you think it's missing something? You think so?

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.japanese: ほら もっとメジャーなペンギンもいたほうが盛り上がる気がするんだけどなぁ
13.english: I think it'd be even more popular if they had a more  well-known penguin in it.

15.speaker: POLAR BEAR
15.japanese: キタイワトビペンギンとか

16.speaker: PENGUIN
16.japanese: どうして素直に答えられないのかな
16.english: Why can't you just be a little more sincere?

17.speaker: SASAKO
17.english: Do you want to be in the show?

18.speaker: PENGUIN
18.japanese: 別に出たくはないんだけどさ
18.english: Well, not really. But don't you think it'd do better with some traditional comedic storytelling?

19.speaker: SASAKO
19.japanese: それは 地味ですね

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: 地味かどうか 聞いてみる？
20.english: How about listening for yourself if it's dull or not?

21.speaker: PERSON
21.japanese: すみません 注文いいですか？
21.english: Pardon me, could we order now?

23.speaker: SASAKO
23.japanese: すみません 今忙しいのでこれを私だと思って…
23.english: Sorry, I'm a little busy right now. So please think of this as me.

24.speaker: PENGUIN
24.japanese: あのね 土偶相手に落語するほど暇じゃないんだよ 僕は…
24.english: You know, I'm not so bored that I can tell comedic stories to a clay statue.

25.speaker: SASAKO
25.japanese: 今 おうかがいします

26.speaker: PANDA
26.japanese: もう… 僕の話を聞いてよ

27.speaker: PENGUIN
27.japanese: あぁ ごめん… 何だっけ？
27.english: Oh, sorry. What were we talking about?

28.speaker: PANDA
28.japanese: パンダコーナーが暇なの～

29.speaker: PANDA
29.japanese: ただでさえ暇なのに お客さんもいないなんて…
29.english: It's already boring to begin with, and now there aren't any visitors!

31.speaker: LLAMA
31.japanese: でも ショーのおかげで お客さん増えたって
31.english: But Mr. Handa was mentioning how the show brought in more visitors

32.speaker: LLAMA
32.japanese: 半田さん 喜んでましたよ
32.english: and was rather happy about it.

34.speaker: LLAMA
34.japanese: まあ… 僕には関係ありませんが
34.english: Well... it doesn't really concern me.

35.speaker: POLAR BEAR
35.japanese: パンダくんも頑張って 動物園を盛り上げたら？
35.english: How about you work harder to make the zoo exciting, Panda?

36.speaker: PANDA
36.english: I wonder if I can do it...

38.speaker: PENGUIN
38.japanese: パンダくんにしては珍しいね

40.speaker: SASAKO
40.japanese: ホットジンジャーだよ

41.speaker: PANDA
41.japanese: おいしそうな匂いがする～

42.speaker: SASAKO
42.japanese: 手作りの生姜シロップで作ったんだよ
42.english: I made it from homemade ginger syrup.

43.speaker: SASAKO
43.japanese: それ飲んで 元気出して

44.speaker: PANDA
44.english: Thank you. Hot ginger is delicious.

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.japanese: それは デンジャー

47.speaker: LLAMA
47.japanese: それは 炊飯ジャー
47.english: That would be a rice cooker {\i1}(suihanjaa){\i0}.

48.speaker: PANDA
48.japanese: これは ホットジンジャー

49.speaker: PANDA
49.japanese: 人気なのは ペンギンジャー
49.english: And what's popular is Penguinger. So bored...

50.speaker: FT PANDA
50.english: I'm catching up with my side job.

52.speaker: FT PANDA
52.japanese: じゃあ 内職手伝ってくれる？
52.english: Then will you help me with my side job?

53.speaker: PANDA
53.english: Well, let me think... Nah, that's okay.

56.speaker: RINRIN
56.japanese: パンダくん お疲れ！
56.english: Panda! Thanks for your hard work!

58.speaker: RINRIN
58.japanese: もしかして パンダコーナーの人気が下がって へこんでるの？
58.english: Could it be you're depressed since the Panda Corner's popularity has slipped? How did you guess?

60.speaker: PANDA
60.japanese: リンリンには 関係ないやい！
60.english: It's none of your business, Rin Rin!

62.speaker: RINRIN
62.japanese: 僕でも 力になれるかもしれないよ！
62.english: I might be able to help somehow.

63.speaker: RINRIN
63.japanese: ほら パンダくんが元気ないと
63.english: Because you know, if you're sad,

64.speaker: RINRIN
64.japanese: 僕も 元気 出ないからさ

65.speaker: PANDA
65.japanese: どうやったらお客さん 来てくれるかな？
65.english: I wonder how we can get more visitors...

66.speaker: RINRIN
66.japanese: それなら写真コンテストなんて どうかな？

68.speaker: RINRIN
68.japanese: ほら こんな感じでさ

69.speaker: RINRIN
69.japanese: 写真コンテストを開催したら みんな来てくれるよ
69.english: If you hold a photo contest, you're bound to get visitors.

70.speaker: PANDA
70.english: That might be a good idea.

71.speaker: RINRIN
71.japanese: それで 人気投票して
71.english: The one voted most popular will get the grand pri— We don't have any money to spend.

72.speaker: PANDA
72.japanese: 豪華な賞品とかは ムリムリ
72.english: There's no way we could afford a fancy prize.

73.speaker: RINRIN
73.japanese: お金がかからない賞品だよ
73.english: It's a prize that won't require money. What?

74.speaker: RINRIN
74.japanese: パンダと一日遊べる券！
74.english: The chance to spend a whole day playing with Panda.

76.speaker: RINRIN
76.japanese: どう？ これなら予算もかからないよ
76.english: What do you think? Then you won't have to spend any money.

77.speaker: PANDA
77.japanese: それ すごいアイデアな気がする！
77.english: I think that might be a great idea!

79.speaker: PANDA
79.japanese: いっぱい 写真撮ってもらえて！
79.english: I can get lots of pictures taken of me...

80.speaker: RINRIN
80.japanese: コンテストは 大好評
80.english: ...and the contest will be a big hit. And the Panda Corner will be full of visitors!

81.speaker: PANDA
81.japanese: 半田さんに言ってみよ～っと
81.english: I'll go talk to Mr. Handa about it. Hey, Panda!

85.speaker: RINRIN
85.japanese: やっぱり パンダくん かわいい！
85.english: There's no doubt about it. Panda is so cute!

86.speaker: RINRIN
86.japanese: 写真コンテスト 絶対 グランプリとる！
86.english: I'm going to win the grand prize in that photo contest!

88.speaker: MASAKI
88.english: My name is Masaki. I'm currently an apprentice under Mr. Tree Kangaroo to become a coffee roaster.

89.speaker: MASAKI
89.japanese: 毎日 毎日 ハンドピックばっかり

90.speaker: MASAKI
90.japanese: 早く 焙煎したいっす
90.english: I want to start roasting already.

91.speaker: MAMA RS
91.japanese: マサキ！ 口よりも手を動かす！
91.english: Masaki. Move your hands, not your mouth.

93.speaker: MASAKI
93.japanese: 師匠 かっこいいっす！

94.speaker: MASAKI
94.japanese: 俺も 早く豆を焼いてみたい～！
94.english: I want to roast beans as soon as possible!

99.speaker: TREE
99.japanese: ただしハンドピックで ハネた 欠点豆でな
99.english: However, you'll roast the beans that didn't pass the handpicking. Oh, so first I'll practice with the rejected beans.

100.speaker: MASAKI
100.japanese: よ～し 毎日 見てて 機械の使い方は覚えてるっす！
100.english: All right! I totally know how to use that machine after watching you every day!

101.speaker: TREE
101.japanese: 焙煎機は使わないんだな
101.english: You won't be using the roasting machine.

103.speaker: MASAKI
103.japanese: 全然 かっこよくないっす…
103.english: This is so lame. Beginners have to start with that.

104.speaker: SQUIRREL1
104.japanese: ほらほら ちゃんと揺すらないと…
104.english: Come on now. Make sure you stir them properly.

105.speaker: SQUIRREL2
105.japanese: 一部だけ焦げちゃうわよ～？
105.english: If you don't, some of the beans will burn.

107.speaker: MASAKI
107.japanese: あっ いい香りがしてきた！
107.english: Hey! It's starting to smell good! How's that look? It doesn't look that different from the good beans.

108.speaker: MAMA RS
108.japanese: あら 中までちゃんと焼けてるわ
108.english: Oh my, it's roasted nicely through the middle.

109.speaker: SQUIRREL1
109.japanese: 初めてにしてはいいんじゃない
109.english: Not bad for your first try.

111.speaker: MASAKI
111.japanese: よ～し うまく焼けたから いれてみちゃえ！
111.english: All right. Since it looks good, let's try it!

112.speaker: MASAKI
112.japanese: よし じゃあ マイカップでドリップ…
112.english: All right. Now to drip brew some in my cu—

113.speaker: MAMA RS
113.japanese: よいしょ よいしょ よっこらせ
113.english: One, two, one, two, there we go.

114.speaker: MAMA RS
114.japanese: マサキ ちょっと熱めの４２℃でお願いね
114.english: Masaki, I'd like mine at about 42 degrees so it's plenty hot.

116.speaker: MASAKI
116.english: And the Masaki coffee is complete!

117.speaker: MASAKI
117.japanese: あれ？ なんか変な匂い…
117.english: Huh? It smells sort of weird.

118.speaker: MASAKI
118.english: S-So gross... I was completely deceived by the really good smell when it was roasting.

119.speaker: MAMA RS
119.japanese: ね？ わかったでしょ
119.english: See? Do you get it now?

120.speaker: SQUIRREL1
120.japanese: カビた豆とかが混じると
120.english: You get terrible tasting coffee when moldy beans get mixed in.

121.speaker: SQUIRREL2
121.japanese: 焙煎しちゃうと 見た目があまりわからなくなるのよね
121.english: And when you roast them, you can't really tell them apart just by looking.

122.speaker: SQUIRREL3
122.japanese: だからいいかげんなコーヒー豆屋はハンドピックをないがしろにしてたりするのよ～
122.english: So, mediocre coffee shops sometimes don't know the value of handpicking.

124.speaker: MASAKI
124.japanese: 最初から知ってたんすか？
124.english: Did you know this would happen from the start?

125.speaker: MAMA RS
125.japanese: 身をもって素材が大切なことがわかったでしょ
125.english: Now you know personally how important the raw materials are.

127.speaker: TREE
127.japanese: つまりキノボリコーヒーが おいしいのは
127.english: So the reason Tree Kangaroo Coffee is good

128.speaker: TREE
128.japanese: マサキたちが頑張ってくれてるからなんだな
128.english: is because all of you work so hard.

130.speaker: MASAKI
130.english: I'll continue to do my best!

131.speaker: TREE
131.japanese: じゃあ 今日やる分なんだな
131.english: Well, then here's your batch for today.

133.speaker: PANDAS
133.japanese: サービス サービス

134.speaker: RINRIN
134.japanese: 写真コンテスト 大成功だな
134.english: Looks like the photo contest is going great.

135.speaker: PANDAS
135.japanese: サービス サービス サービス サービス

136.speaker: RINRIN
136.japanese: 絶対 グランプリとるぞ！
136.english: The grand prize is going to be mine!

137.speaker: SPEAKER
137.japanese: 間もなくペンギン戦隊ショーが始まります
137.english: The Penguin Action Hero Showwill be starting momentarily.

138.speaker: PANDAS
138.japanese: サービス サービス

141.speaker: FT PANDA
141.japanese: さてと 内職 内職
141.english: Well, now it's time for the side job.

142.speaker: PENGUINS
142.japanese: 南極戦隊 ペンギンジャー！

145.speaker: PENGUINS
145.english: The islands of the South Pole

146.speaker: PENGUINS
146.japanese: 南極の島々は 渡さないぞ！
146.english: will never fall into your hands as long as we're here!

148.speaker: PENGUIN
148.english: The battle is not yet over, Penguingers.

150.speaker: PENGUIN
150.japanese: 白い南極を邪悪な黒いブリザードで凍らせる
150.english: I am the one who freezes the white South Pole with a dark, black blizzard.

151.speaker: PENGUIN
151.japanese: マイナス６０℃の冷たいハートを持つ男
151.english: The one with the cold heart of -60 degrees.

152.speaker: PENGUIN
152.english: The ruler of the South Pole...

154.speaker: PENGUIN
154.japanese: ペンギンジャーよ 呪いの落語を聞け～！
154.english: Penguingers, listen to the comedic storytelling of doom!

156.speaker: ADELIE
156.japanese: 聞いたら ぬいぐるみにされるぞ！
156.english: If you hear it, you'll be turned into plushies! What?!

157.speaker: PENGUIN
157.japanese: え～ まいどバカバカしい噺をひとつ
157.english: Well, let's start off with a slightly idiotic tale.

158.speaker: PENGUIN
158.japanese: 俺の怖いものは まんじゅう
158.english: The things I'm scared of are manju.

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.japanese: まんじゅうってのはどんな虫だい？
159.english: What kind of bugs are manju?

162.speaker: SASAKO
162.japanese: ペンギンさん 自分が出たかったんですか？
162.english: Did you just want to be in the show, Mr. Penguin?

163.speaker: PENGUIN
163.japanese: 何を言うんだい？ 笹子さん
163.english: What are you talking about, Miss Sasako? Actually, I didn't have much of a choice.

164.speaker: POLAR BEAR
164.english: You just wanted to be in it.

165.speaker: PENGUIN
165.japanese: はい そうです ごめんなさい

167.speaker: PANDA
167.japanese: 写真コンテストのお客さん みんな ペンギンジャーのほうへ行っちゃったよ…
167.english: All of the visitors that were doing the photo contest went over to the Penguinger show.

168.speaker: PANDA
168.japanese: ねぇ シロクマくん

169.speaker: PANDA
169.japanese: もっといいアイデアないかな？
169.english: Do you have any better ideas?

170.speaker: POLAR BEAR
170.english: Well, let's see... How about this?

172.speaker: SPEAKER
172.japanese: まもなく パンダコーナーにて 『パンダ家族』を上演いたします
172.english: The Panda Family will be performed in the Panda Corner momentarily.

173.speaker: PENGUIN
173.japanese: これは ごく普通の下町の
173.english: This is an ordinary tale about an ordinary family

174.speaker: PENGUIN
174.english: that lives in an ordinary town.

175.speaker: PENGUIN
175.japanese: でも ただ１つ違っていたのは
175.english: The only unusual thing about them

176.speaker: PENGUIN
176.japanese: 家族が パンダだったのです
176.english: is that they're a family of pandas.

177.speaker: PANDA MAMA
177.japanese: お父さん 食事中は 新聞やめてください
177.english: Darling, could you not read the paper while we're eating?

178.speaker: MEIMEI
178.japanese: お母さ～ん 私 パンがいいな～

180.speaker: PANDA MAMA
180.japanese: パンダなんだから 笹を食べなさい
180.english: You're a panda, so you'll eat bamboo grass.

181.speaker: PANDA MAMA
181.japanese: おじいちゃんも 食べながら太極拳しないで
181.english: And, Grandpa, no doing tai chi while you're eating.

182.speaker: GRANPA
182.english: A balanced diet leads to a healthy body.

183.speaker: PANDA
183.japanese: お母さん 笹 おかわり～
183.english: Can I get some more bamboo grass, Mom? Oh, all right.

184.speaker: PANDA MAMA
184.japanese: それより あなた 将来 どうするの？
184.english: More importantly, what are you going to do about your future?

185.speaker: PANDA MAMA
185.japanese: 毎日 ダラダラして
185.english: All you do is lay around all day.

186.speaker: PANDA
186.japanese: ダラダラじゃないよ ゴロゴロだよ～
186.english: I don't lay around. I laze around.

187.speaker: PANDA
187.japanese: そのくらいの区別ちゃんと見分けてよ～
187.english: You should be able to tell the difference by now. Don't suck me up!

188.speaker: PANDA MAMA
188.english: Darling, put down the paper. Don't suck me up!

192.speaker: PANDA MAMA
192.japanese: えっ！？行方不明の長男が見つかった！？
192.english: What? Our missing eldest son has been found?

194.speaker: PANDA
194.japanese: ストイコビッチ兄さんが！？

196.speaker: PANDA MAMA
196.japanese: まぁ ストイコビッチ

197.speaker: PANDA MAMA
197.japanese: こんなにもすっかり大きくなって…

199.speaker: PANDA MAMA
199.japanese: ほら お父さん ストイコビッチよ

200.speaker: FT PANDA
200.japanese: お前が 家を飛び出したとき

201.japanese: 二度と 家の敷居はまたがせないと言ったはずだぞ
201.english: when you rushed out that door to never come back.

203.speaker: POLAR BEAR
203.english: I'll carry on the family business after all.

204.speaker: FT PANDA
204.japanese: ほんとか！？ ストイコビッチ！

205.speaker: GRANPA
205.japanese: ほんとか！？ ストイコビッチ！

207.japanese: 家の家業が嫌で 家出したのに…
207.english: You ran away because you didn't like the family business. {\a6}Indulging in every possible luxury.

208.speaker: POLAR BEAR
208.english: After seeing this vast world, I realized that I was only concerned with the small meaningless things.

210.speaker: POLAR BEAR
210.japanese: 父さん 僕 立派な屁負い比丘尼になるよ
210.english: I'll be the best flatus patsy ever, Dad.

211.speaker: GRANPA
211.japanese: ありがとう ストイコビッチ

212.speaker: FT PANDA
212.japanese: ありがとう ストイコビッチ

213.speaker: GRANPA
213.japanese: 屁負い比丘尼ってなに？

214.speaker: PANDA
214.japanese: 屁負い比丘尼ってなに？

215.speaker: GRANPA
215.japanese: 男の人の仕事じゃないわね

216.speaker: MEIMEI
216.japanese: 男の人の仕事じゃないわね
216.english: It's not a job for a guy.

217.speaker: PANDA MAMA
217.japanese: お風呂が沸いてるわよ
217.english: There's a bath ready for you. {\a6}One-plate meal.

218.speaker: PANDA MAMA
218.japanese: 長年のアカを落としておいで
218.english: Go wash off the years of dirt.

221.speaker: PANDA
221.japanese: 兄さん パンダじゃないの？
221.english: Brother, you're not a panda? {\a6}First and probably the last.

223.speaker: FT PANDA
223.japanese: 実はストイコビッチはシロクマなんだ
223.english: Well, you see, Stojković is a polar bear.

225.speaker: PANDA
225.japanese: 全然気づかなかったよ

226.speaker: GRANPA
226.english: A bolt out of the blue!

227.speaker: POLAR BEAR
227.japanese: ついでにカミングアウトすると…

228.speaker: POLAR BEAR
228.japanese: ほんとはお兄さんじゃなくて…
228.english: I'm actually not your older brother.

231.speaker: FT PANDA
231.japanese: すまん お前達にもいずれ話すつもりだったんだが…
231.english: Sorry. We were going to tell you one day.

233.speaker: PANDA
233.japanese: 兄さん！！ いや 姉さん！？

237.speaker: POLAR BEAR
237.english: Good boy. It's the start of a new family.

239.speaker: PANDA MAMA
239.japanese: 血のつながった親子でさえ わかりあうのが難しい時代よ
239.english: These are such hard times that even families may not understand each other.

240.speaker: FT PANDA
240.japanese: 広い世界に一つくらい
240.english: I think it's all right for a family like this

241.japanese: こんな家族があってもいいんじゃないかな
241.english: to exist in this vast world.

243.speaker: GRANPA
243.japanese: めでたし めでたし！

244.speaker: PANDA
244.japanese: パンダコーナーの企画 大成功だったね！
244.english: The Panda Corner project was a huge success!

245.speaker: PENGUIN
245.japanese: 赤ん坊の熱演したかいがあったよ
245.english: Thanks to my passionate role as the baby.

246.speaker: SASAKO
246.japanese: すごい人気だったんだってね
246.english: I heard it was really popular.

247.speaker: SASAKO
247.japanese: よかったね パンダくん

248.speaker: PANDA
248.japanese: うん！ 再公演をやることも決まったんだ～！
248.english: Yeah! And we're going to have an encore performance!

249.speaker: POLAR BEAR
249.japanese: 皆さん お疲れさまでした
249.english: Thank you for all your hard work, everyone.

250.speaker: POLAR BEAR
250.english: Here you go. Wow it looks so good!

252.speaker: PENGUIN
252.japanese: ねぇ ねぇ 劇の間に 僕の落語を入れない？
252.english: Hey, how about we put my comedic storytelling in the play? Nah, that's okay.

253.speaker: PENGUIN
253.japanese: なんで？ パンダくん
253.english: Why, Panda? Have you even heard my comedic storytelling before? I don't have to.

255.speaker: PANDA
255.english: Coming. Yeah! I got the grand prize in the photo contest!

258.speaker: FT PANDA
258.japanese: いやぁ 待ってたよ 林くん
258.english: I was waiting for you, Hayashi.

259.speaker: FT PANDA
259.japanese: じゃあ 一緒に遊ぼうか！

260.speaker: FT PANDA
260.japanese: こっちのティッシュに…
260.english: This is a brand new game where we both

261.speaker: FT PANDA
261.japanese: そっちのチラシを２人でいれるっていう斬新な遊びだよ
261.english: put these ads into these tissue packs.

262.speaker: FT PANDA
262.japanese: どう？ 楽しそうでしょ
262.english: What do you think? Sounds fun, right?

263.speaker: FT PANDA
263.japanese: じゃあ これが林くんの分ね

264.speaker: FT PANDA
264.english: Let's have a fun day together.

266.speaker: PANDA
266.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

270.speaker: PANDA
270.japanese: それで話は変わるんだけど

271.speaker: PENGUIN
271.japanese: 話変わるの まあ いいけどさ
271.english: You're changing the subject? Well, whatever.

272.speaker: PANDA
272.japanese: 手っ取り早くちやほやされたいんだけど
272.english: I want someone to make a fuss over me very quickly.

274.speaker: PENGUIN
274.japanese: パンダ君って最高に可愛いんじゃない
274.english: I think you're super cute, Panda.

275.speaker: PANDA
275.japanese: シロクマ君 終わろう

276.speaker: PENGUIN
276.japanese: シロクマ君 終わろう

277.speaker: POLAR BEAR
277.japanese: 来週のシロクマカフェは

278.speaker: POLAR BEAR
278.japanese: 目に入った時は擦らず
278.english: If you get it in your eyes, please don't rub them

279.speaker: POLAR BEAR
279.japanese: 水で洗い流してください

280.speaker: PENGUIN
280.japanese: 何の説明になっちゃった
280.english: Exactly what did you end up explaining?
